org.sd.nlp
Class NormalizedString

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.nlp.NormalizedString

public final class NormalizedString
extends java.lang.Object

Container for a normalized string mapping it back to its original form.

Typically, a Normalizer will create an appropriate NormalizedString, but the "buildLowerCaseInstance" factory method is available for use in trivial cases.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Nested Class Summary
 class NormalizedString.Token
          Container class for a normalized string token.

getPreceding

public final NormalizedString getPreceding(int normalizedStartIndex)
Get a new normalized string for the portion of this normalized string preceding the normalized start index (exclusive). Remove extra whitespace at the end of the returned string.

Returns:
the preceding normalized string or null if empty (after skipping white).

getPreceding

public final NormalizedString getPreceding(int normalizedStartIndex,
                                           boolean checkEndBreak)
Get a new normalized string for the portion of this normalized string preceding the normalized start index (exclusive). Remove extra whitespace at the end of the returned string.

Returns:
the preceding normalized string or null if empty (after skipping white).

getPrecedingIndex

public final int getPrecedingIndex(int normalizedPos,
                                   int numTokens)
Find the (normalized) index of the nth token preceding the normalizedPos.

If normalizedPos is -1, start from the end of the string. If the beginning of the string is fewer than numTokens prior to normalizedPos, return the beginning of the string.

findPrecedingTokenStart

public final int findPrecedingTokenStart(int normalizedPos)
Find the start of the token before the normalizedPos.

If normalizedPos is at a token start, the prior token will be returned; otherwise, the start of the token of which normalizedPos is a part will be returned.

getRemaining

public final NormalizedString getRemaining(int normalizedStartIndex)
Get a new normalized string for the portion of this normalized string following the normalized start index (inclusive). Remove extra whitespace at the beginning of the returned string.

Returns:
the following normalized string or null if empty (after skipping white).

                                                    int normalizedEndIndex)
Build a normalized string from this using the given normalized index range.

Determine whether the original character corresponding to the normalized index is a letter or digit.

findPreviousSymbolIndex

public final int findPreviousSymbolIndex(int nIndex)
Get the ORIGINAL index of the first symbol (non-letter, digit, or white character) prior to the NORMALIZED index in the full original string.

Returns:
-1 if no symbol is found or the index of the found symbol in the original input string.
